title: iBudget Waiver
shortDescription: Florida's Medicaid waiver providing individualized budgets for home and community-based services for individuals with developmental disabilities including autism.
description: The iBudget (Individual Budgeting) Waiver is Florida's primary Medicaid Home and Community-Based Services (HCBS) waiver for individuals with developmental disabilities, including autism spectrum disorder. Officially known as the FL Developmental Disabilities Individual Budgeting Waiver (0867.R03.00), it provides an individualized budget based on each person's assessed needs, allowing recipients to choose services and providers that best meet their requirements. The waiver is administered by the Agency for Persons with Disabilities (APD) and operates under Section 1915(c) authority with concurrent 1915(j) self-direction authority. Unlike traditional fee-for-service Medicaid, iBudget gives families flexibility to direct their own services within their allocated budget.
coveredServices: Life Skills Development Level 2 - Supported Employment
Life Skills Development Level 3 - Adult Day Training
Life Skills Development Level 4 - Prevocational Services
eligibility: Diagnosis of developmental disability (including autism spectrum disorder, intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, spina bifida, Prader-Willi syndrome, or similar conditions)
Disability must have manifested before age 18
Must meet ICF/IID (Intermediate Care Facility for Individuals with Intellectual Disabilities) level of care
Must be enrolled with the Agency for Persons with Disabilities (APD)
howToApply: Contact your local APD regional office to begin the application process
Complete the APD application for services
Undergo eligibility determination including developmental disability verification
If eligible, you will be placed on the waitlist (wait times vary significantly by region)
Once a slot becomes available, complete the enrollment process
Work with your Waiver Support Coordinator to develop your person-centered support plan
Choose your service providers and begin receiving services
benefits: Individualized budget based on your specific assessed needs
Flexibility to choose your own service providers
Self-direction option (CDC+) allows you to manage your own budget
Covers services not available through regular Medicaid
Supports living in your home and community rather than institutional settings
Comprehensive range of therapies including ABA, speech, OT, and PT
Environmental modifications to make your home accessible
Respite care to give family caregivers a break
Transportation to medical appointments and community activities
importantNotes: There is typically a waitlist due to high demand - wait times can be several years
Budget amounts are determined by an algorithm based on assessed needs
Services must be included in your approved support plan
Annual re-evaluations are required to maintain eligibility
You can choose traditional waiver services or the CDC+ self-direction option
